sub_title: Head of Contracts & Procurement at Shtokman Development AG
summary:
With over 16 years in the oil and gas industry, I consider myself fortunate to be working in a field that is experiencing large scale changes and meeting them head on. I like the innovation and technical challenges of the oil and gas industry. In progressively more responsible roles, I’ve contributed to the industry growth strategy in commercial, operational and excellence areas. 

Experienced in a diverse range of commercial finance activities including Financial Planning, Appraisal, Investments, Divestments, Contract Negotiation, Contract Management advisory, Strategic business review, Cost analysis, Continuous Improvement, economic evaluation, identification and quantification of risks and the development and implementation of robust and fit for purpose control. 

One of my strengths is the ability to see and connect seemingly disparate markets, developing new business opportunities. With my expertise in negotiations, understanding large, complex commercial transactions, I thrive in impactful roles where I can turn an idea into a reality an drive change. Confident  in working virtually in a Global organisation and proven ability to engage and influence senior stakeholders


My career spans across different areas of the energy sector (fuels and lubricants supply chain, pipeline and LNG gas commercial and operations, drilling and quality inspection, upstream economics and research), and in a wide spectrum of business activities and roles such as trading and origination, asset divestments and optimisation, business development and supply chain.


Specialties: supply chain optimisation, trading and origination, short and long-term commercial contracts, negotiations, market entries, asset divestments and business development, commercial and operational experience.

profile_positions.description:
Project for the development of Shtokman gas field in Barenz sea, including Floating Production unit, 550 km of subsea pipelines, LNG plant and gas transfer unit.

Development and production of oil on the territory of Verkhnechonskoye oil, gas and condensate field, which is located in Katangsky district of Irkutsk oblast in the catchment-basin of the upper Chona-river, 1100 km to the North-East from Irkutsk and 250 km from Kirensk. It is one of the largest oil fields in Irkutsk oblast.
profile_positions.title: Head of Contracts & Procurement

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all 3rd party Global Commercial spend in Netherlands.

Align with the relevant (Global) Category Managers and other stakeholders on strategy for addressing 3rd party spend and ensure implementation of resulting contracts in Netherlands & CEE.

Prepare and implement procurement strategies for all 3rd party spend within Global Commercial Business in Russia & CEE, in line with Streamline processes, agreed governance (e.g. contract boards) and Manual of Authority (MoA).

Manage all 3rd party spend in Netherlands & CEE and achieve targeted cost reduction and other value improvements

Closely engage and work with stakeholders to ensure:
- Clear understanding of the business requirements and objectives
- Allocation of the required resources for preparing and implementing procurement strategies
- Management of the contracts such that Shell gets maximum value out of those
- Awareness of and adherence to procurement processes

Build up and maintain an up-to-date view of and knowledge about the supply markets relevant to the Global Commercial businesses

Establish and maintain productive relationships with (key) suppliers.

Within Netherlands & CEE, act as the Global Commercial C&P lead for suppliers and the GC stakeholder community, also where the procurement activity may be done by other parts of the C&P organization (e.g. S&D, GCS, Retail, Sourcing, RtP, etc.)

Support the implementation of Channel Management and the delivery of the Requisition to Pay (RtP) KPIs

Use and keep up-to-date the various tools & systems such as the Contract Management System (CMS), the Supplier Qualification System (SQS), the saving reporting tools (eVita), etc.
